description: Erection of two storey extension at side and part single and part two storey extension at rear of no 45 and part single and part two storey extension including new dormer window at rear and first floor extension at side of the house at no 47
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.  REASON:	To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings. | All new windows in the side elevations shall be fixed with obscure glazing before first occupation of the extension and shall be retained  as such thereafter.   REASON:	In the interests of privacy of nearby residents. | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995, no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted  REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties and the visual appearance of the area. | The garage accommodation shall only be used for parking of motor vehicles ancillary to dwellinghouses and shall not be used for any other purposes.  REASON:	To ensure that adequate parking accommodation is retained within the site. | The development permitted shall be commenced and completed in its entirety and simultaneously.  REASON:	In the interests of visual appearance and to ensure the livng conditions of the occupiers of each property is protected. | Notwithstanding any indication given in the approved drawings the depth of the proposed two storey part of the rear extension to nos. 45 and 47 shall not project beyond the existing two storey rear extension to nos. 43 and 49 respectively.     REASON:	In the interests of the amenities of nearby occupiers. | Notwithstanding any indication given in the approved drawings a minimum gap of 1 metre shall be maintained at first floor level  between the houses subject of the application. For avoidance of doubt the proposed first floor side extension to no 47 shall be set-in at least one metre from the common boundary with no 45 at first floor level.   REASON:	To maintain the detached character of the houses and visual amenity of the area.
